listings.Name: 280 Fell Street Apartments
listings.Legal_Disclaimers:
All BMR renters must review and acknowledge the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 that governs this property upon the signing of a lease for a BMR unit.
 
Applicants should be informed that BMR rental units in some buildings may convert to ownership units in the future.  In the case of conversion, BMR renters will be afforded certain rights as explained in the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013. Applicants should inquire with the building contact person listed above to determine if the building has a minimum number of years that it must remain a rental building.  (Some buildings may have such restrictions based on government sources of financing for their building.) Most buildings may have no restrictions on conversion at all.
 
It is also important to note that units governed by the Inclusionary Housing Program are NOT governed by the San Francisco Rent Ordinance (also known as “rent control”). Among other rules, rents may increase beyond increases allowed under “rent control.”  Please see the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 for more information.
listings.Credit_Rating:
Provide a credit report with score from Equifax, Experian, or TransUnion dated within thirty (30) days of the application. 

Accounts that are not current or that are derogatory will negatively affect the overall scoring, which could result in the denial of the application or an additional deposit may be required. 

Collection accounts exceeding a combined amount of $1,000.00 (excluding student loans and medical debt) will negatively affect the overall scoring, which could result in the denial of the application or an additional deposit may be required. 

Bankruptcy if not cleared will be an automatic denial of the rental application. 

No Guarantors permitted.

Mitigating circumstances may be considered.
listings.Eviction_History:
Provide minimum of 4 years rental history with at least two prior rentals in which you were responsible for paying the rent.  Applicants without rental history will still be considered. No Guarantors permitted. 

Previous rental history will be reviewed and must exhibit no derogatory references. 

Landlord references will only check for evictions, payment history, and documented lease violations. No-fault evictions (Ellis Act, Owner Move-in evictions) will not be held against a household. 

All debt owed to an apartment community must be satisfied. 

Mitigating circumstances may be considered.
listings.Costs_Not_Included:
Tenants pay for gas, electricity.

For pet fees:  Cat is allowed with a $500 refundable deposit, $250 non-refundable cleaning fee and a pet addendum.  

Dogs are not allowed in the building.  

One parking space per unit available for $175 a month.
listings.Amenities: Laundry room, underground parking, courtyard, bike room
listings.Required_Documents: Lottery winners will be required to fill out a building application and provide a copy of your current credit report, 3 most recent paystubs, current tax returns and W-2, and 3 most recent bank statements.
listings.Pet_Policy: Dogs are not allowed in the building.

Lottery_Preference.Name: Live or Work in San Francisco Preference

listings.Name: Nema
listings.Legal_Disclaimers:
All BMR renters must review and acknowledge the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 that governs this property upon the signing of a lease for a BMR unit.
 
Applicants should be informed that BMR rental units in some buildings may convert to ownership units in the future.  In the case of conversion, BMR renters will be afforded certain rights as explained in the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013. Applicants should inquire with the building contact person listed above to determine if the building has a minimum number of years that it must remain a rental building.  (Some buildings may have such restrictions based on government sources of financing for their building.) Most buildings may have no restrictions on conversion at all.
 
It is also important to note that units governed by the Inclusionary Housing Program are NOT governed by the San Francisco Rent Ordinance (also known as “rent control”). Among other rules, rents may increase beyond increases allowed under “rent control.”  Please see the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 for more information.
listings.Credit_Rating: A credit report indicating FICO score at least 600 or higher with financial responsibilities and a comprehensive unlawful detainer check will be obtained for each adult applicant. Unless satisfactorily explained, there must be no judgements, no accounts rated over 90 days delinquent and a bankruptcy must be discharged for at least one year to make the credit report acceptable. Applicant will not be declined for not having any credit history. Applicant must demonstrate ability to meet all financial obligations
listings.Eviction_History: Both current and previous landlords (going back five years), will be contacted for information concerning the applicants history of complying with lease requirements, payment records, destruction of property or interference with the rights of others, physical hazards or unhealthy or unsanitary conditions or illegal activities.
listings.Costs_Not_Included:
Pet deposit: $500 per pet and $75 per month pet fee.

Replacement fobs/remotes are $50 each.

Late rent payment fee is $50, unpaid balance after 5th of the month.

Renter is charged $55 per month (studio pricing) and $75 per month (1 bedroom pricing) by NEMA for gas, water and garbage. 

Renter is responsible for electric bill.
listings.Amenities: Laundry, parking, fitness center, outdoor living spaces, hardwood floors, residents lounge, pool
listings.Accessibility: Accessibility features in common areas like lobby – wheelchair ramps, wheelchair accessible bathrooms and elevators
listings.Required_Documents: Lottery application form, documented proof of any preferences claimed (see application form for details)

Lottery_Preference.Name: Live or Work in San Francisco Preference

listings.Name: Abaca
listings.Legal_Disclaimers:
Applicants should be informed that BMR rental units in some buildings may convert to ownership units in the future.  In the case of conversion, BMR renters will be afforded certain rights as explained in the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013. Applicants should inquire with the building contact person listed above to determine if the building has a minimum number of years that it must remain a rental building.  (Some buildings may have such restrictions based on government sources of financing for their building.) Most buildings may have no restrictions on conversion at all.
 
It is also important to note that units governed by the Inclusionary Housing Program are NOT governed by the San Francisco Rent Ordinance (also known as “rent control”). Among other rules, rents may increase beyond increases allowed under “rent control.”  Please see the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 for more information.
listings.Lottery_Venue: SF Main Public Library, Koret Auditorium
listings.Credit_Rating: Must have a credit score above 499. A credit score between 500 and 649 will be approved with a deposit equal to one month’s rent or a guarantor. The minimum requirements for a guarantor are four times the monthly rent, and a credit score of 720 or higher.
listings.Eviction_History: Must have zero for-cause evictions in the past three years. No-fault evictions (such as Ellis Act or owner move-in evictions) will not be held against a household. There cannot be any open balances, or rental collections in the rental history within the last 3 years.
listings.Costs_Not_Included:
Residents must pay own electricity and telecom bills directly. Residents are charged a flat fee for water, sewer and trash based on unit size: Studios - $68/month, 1-bedrooms - $73/month, 2-bedrooms - $89/month, 3-bedrooms - $97/month. 
19 parking spaces are available to BMR renters in lottery rank order for an additional $100/month.
listings.Amenities: Commercial grade bar & kitchen /resident clubhouse, Shared work space, Fitness center with yoga room, Rooftop deck with bay views, Bike repair shop, Parking garage with controlled access
listings.Accessibility: Elevators in building, all units ADA-accessible
listings.Required_Documents: Additional documentation will be required post-lottery to determine income and program eligibility.
listings.Pet_Policy: $75/month per pet, with a one-time deposit of $500 per pet, maximum 2 pets. Deposit and pet rent do not apply to service and companion animals.

Information_Sessions.Venue: SF Main Public Library, Koret Auditorium

Lottery_Preference.Name: Live or Work in San Francisco Preference

listings.Name: Venn
listings.Office_Hours: Thurs February 23 – Thurs March 2, 2017, 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM
listings.Legal_Disclaimers:
All BMR renters must review and acknowledge the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 that governs this property upon the signing of a lease for a BMR unit.
 
Applicants should be informed that BMR rental units in some buildings may convert to ownership units in the future.  In the case of conversion, BMR renters will be afforded certain rights as explained in the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013. Applicants should inquire with the building contact person listed above to determine if the building has a minimum number of years that it must remain a rental building.  (Some buildings may have such restrictions based on government sources of financing for their building.) Most buildings may have no restrictions on conversion at all.
 
It is also important to note that units governed by the Inclusionary Housing Program are NOT governed by the San Francisco Rent Ordinance (also known as “rent control”). Among other rules, rents may increase beyond increases allowed under “rent control.”  Please see the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 for more information.
listings.Credit_Rating: We obtain a credit report on each applicant once income eligibility has been determined.  Our credit reporting agency evaluates the most recent 24 months of credit (which may include rent payment history) as an indicator of future rent payment performance. Rental collections totaling $2,000 or more will be basis for denial. Medical and Student Loan debt will not be considered. Applicants are responsible for ensuring their credit history is accurate.
listings.Eviction_History: Our credit reporting agency also reviews eviction and court databases to search for both eviction filings and judgements within the past 24 months. No Fault or Dismissed evictions will not be held against the household. If a household does not meet the rental or credit criteria, they will they have the option of either paying an additional deposit equal to 1 times the monthly rent, or providing a qualified guarantor. If the applicant does not provide either of these options, it could result in the denial of their application. Mitigating Circumstances will be considered on a case by case basis.
listings.Costs_Not_Included:
Parking ($100/month).
Pet Deposit is $500 with a $50 monthly pet rent.
Residents encourage to obtain renter’s insurance but this is not a requirement.
listings.Amenities: Terrace and Lounge, Fitness Center, BBQ area, Fire Pit, and Sky Lounge
listings.Accessibility: Accessibility features in common areas like lobby – wheelchair ramps, wheelchair accessible bathrooms and elevators
listings.Required_Documents: Paystubs, 3 months’ bank statements, recent tax returns and W-2's or non-tax affidavit, recent retirement statement.
listings.Pet_Policy:
Pets allowed except the following: Pit Bull Terriers/Staffordshire Terriers, Rottweilers, Doberman Pinschers, Chows, Presa Canarios, Akitas, Alaskan Malamutes, Wolf-hybrids. 
If you have pets, please see your leasing representatives for more information. These restrictions and deposit requirements do not apply to qualified service or assistance animals

listings.Lottery_Venue: Koret Auditorium, Lower Level, San Francisco Public Library
listings.Credit_Rating: A credit report indicating financial responsibilities and a comprehensive unlawful detainer check will be obtained for each adult applicant. Unless satisfactorily explained, there must be no judgments, no accounts rated over 90 days delinquent and no bankruptcy within the last 24 months. Mitigating circumstances will be considered. Applicant will not be declined for not having any credit history. Applicant(s) must have a current credit rating of 620. Medical debt and student loan debt will not be counted against a household. Lack of established credit or credit score lower than 620 will require an additional deposit equal to one month rent. No outstanding debt to other rental communities is permitted at any time. Applicant(s) must have a positive check writing history. If the applicant(s) have/has a negative check writing history, all future payments to the Community must be made with certified funds, mitigating circumstances will be considered.
listings.Eviction_History: Both the current and previous landlords (going back three years) will be contacted for information concerning the applicant's history regarding documented lease violations and for cause evictions.
listings.Costs_Not_Included:
One parking space available for $100 a month. Based on lottery ranking and renter choice.

Late charge if rent not paid on or before the 3rd of the month: 5% of the tenant's monthly rent.
listings.Required_Documents: Full documentation required if the applicant is selected in the lottery.
listings.Pet_Policy: Pets are not allowed except companion/service animals.

Information_Sessions.Venue: San Francisco Public Library, Latino Rooms AB, Lower Level

listings.Name: 30 Dore Unit 104 (Glasdore Lofts)
listings.Preference_Detail:
All individuals and households may enter the lottery for a BMR unit. 

However, those households in which one member holds a Certificate of Preference (COP) from the former San Francisco Redevelopment Agency will be given highest preference in the lottery ranking process. More information about the COP Program can be found here: http://sfmohcd.org/certificate-preference

Households that submit acceptable documentation that at least one member lives or works in San Francisco will be given the fourth highest preference in the lottery ranking process. 

If the number of units available exceeds the number of qualified applicants in the above listed preference, the units will become available to other qualified applicants outside of San Francisco. Applicants in each preference category must meet program requirements in order to complete the sale or rental. 

For more information about the lottery process and housing preferences, please refer to the MOHCD Housing Preferences and Lottery Procedures Manual.
listings.Credit_Rating:
A credit report will be completed on all applicants to verify credit ratings. Income plus verified credit history will be entered into a credit scoring model to determine rental eligibility and security deposit levels. Unfavorable accounts which will negatively influence this score include, but are not limited to: collections, charge-off, repossessions, and current recent delinquency; open bankruptcies will result in an automatic denial of the application. A score of anything below 5 will be denied.

Refer Credit Recommendation occurs on applicants with little or no credit history. In such cases, when there is no credit history, additional information for rental history, income/employment will be required. If the additional information meet our criteria, an Additional Deposit will be required.

ADDITIONAL DEPOSITS WILL BE REQUIRED FOR ALL CREDIT RECOMMENDATIONS BETWEEN SCORES OF 6-7 AND STANDARD SECURITY DEPOSITS WILL BE FOR  SCORES BETWEEN 8-10.
listings.Criminal_History: Qualified applicants with criminal history will be considered for housing in compliance with Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code “Fair Chance Ordinance”
listings.Eviction_History: Some credit scoring results will necessitate an evaluation of verifiable rental or mortgage payment history for the last 24 months. In these instances, applicant must have a minimum of 6 months of cumulative verifiable rental or mortgage payment history within the last 24 months. In such instances, if a previous landlord cannot be contacted, 6 consecutive months of proof of payment must be verified and copy of the lease contract must be provided. Applicants not having verifiable rental or mortgage history will have to pay an additional deposit. When applications also depend on the results of a rental history investigation for an approval/denial determination, applications for residency will automatically be denied for the following reasons:
listings.Costs_Not_Included:
Renter pays electric, phone, and internet bill directly to utility companies.

Renter is charged a fluctuating rate for the following utilities dependent on usage: Water, Sewer, Garbage, and Gas, on a monthly basis and made payable to the property to be paid with rental amount.  Average Utility Bill for a Studio: $100 (subject to change dependent upon usage)
listings.Required_Documents: Full documentation required if the applicant is selected in the lottery.
listings.Pet_Policy: If animals are accepted at the community where application is made, no more than one animal weighing 35 pounds or less full-grown are allowed per apartment. Aggressive breeds will not be allowed. An additional $250.00 pet deposit for cats and $500.00 pet deposit for dogs is required, plus an additional monthly pet rent of $35.00 per cat and $100.00 per dog. Aquariums will be allowed with a 20-gallon maximum on the first floor only with proof of insurance for the entire term of the lease. ***Based on apartment owners approval****

Lottery_Preference.Name: Live or Work in San Francisco Preference

listings.Name: Northpoint Vistas Units 301, 320
listings.Legal_Disclaimers:
2.5 rent in monthly income.
Quiet hours after 10PM.

All BMR renters must review and acknowledge the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 that governs this property upon the signing of a lease for a BMR unit.

Applicants should be informed that BMR rental units in some buildings may convert to ownership units in the future.  In the case of conversion, BMR renters will be afforded certain rights as explained in the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013. Applicants should inquire with the building contact person listed above to determine if the building has a minimum number of years that it must remain a rental building.  (Some buildings may have such restrictions based on government sources of financing for their building.) Most buildings may have no restrictions on conversion at all.
 
It is also important to note that units governed by the Inclusionary Housing Program are NOT governed by the San Francisco Rent Ordinance (also known as “rent control”). Among other rules, rents may increase beyond increases allowed under “rent control.”  Please see the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 for more information.
listings.Credit_Rating:
No Bankruptcy, Charge-offs, Judgements in the last 5 yrs.
No filings/unlawful detainers in the last 1 yr.
No forcible detainers in the last 7yrs
listings.Eviction_History:
No more than 2 late payments in the last 1yr.
No more than 2 NSF in the last 2yrs.
listings.Costs_Not_Included:
One parking space per unit available for $100 a month.

$500 Pet Deposit.  Pets okay under 35lbs.

Rent is due on the 1st of each month and considered late by the 2nd however the late fee is assessed on the 11th and just $25.00.
listings.Required_Documents: Full documentation required if the applicant is selected in the lottery.
listings.Smoking_Policy: No smoking in the common areas

listings.Legal_Disclaimers:

listings.Lottery_Summary: Out of 514 applicant received, 60 numbers were pulled.
listings.Lottery_Venue: Mayor's Office of Housing and Community Development
listings.Preference_Detail:
All individuals and households may enter the lottery for a BMR unit. 

However, those households in which one member holds a Certificate of Preference (COP) from the former San Francisco Redevelopment Agency will be given highest preference in the lottery ranking process. More information about the COP Program can be found here: http://sfmohcd.org/certificate-preference. 

Households in which one member holds a Displaced Tenant Housing Preference (DTHP) Certificate from the Mayor’s Office of Housing and Community Development will be given second highest preference in the lottery ranking process, for up to 20% of the units in this project (80 units). DTHP certificate holders will also be included in the live/work preference regardless of their current live/work location. More information about the DTHP Program can be found here: http://sfmohcd.org/displaced-tenant-housing-preference-program-0. 

Households that submit acceptable documentation that at least one member lives or works in San Francisco will be given the fourth highest preference in the lottery ranking process. 

If the number of units available exceeds the number of qualified applicants in the above listed preference, the units will become available to other qualified applicants outside of San Francisco. Applicants in each preference category must meet program requirements in order to complete the sale or rental. 

For more information about the lottery process and housing preferences, please refer to the MOHCD Housing Preferences and Lottery Procedures Manual.
listings.Credit_Rating:
No unlawful detainers. 

No unpaid judgements within the past [5] years. 

No unpaid Tax Liens within the past [3] years. 

No bankruptcies within the past [3] years. 

Total of 4,000 in debt or more with the exception of a payment arrangement making payment towards their debt.
listings.Eviction_History: Reference check - past 2 years
listings.Costs_Not_Included: Renter pays own utility bills directly (landlord pays water and trash).
listings.Required_Documents: Full documentation required if applicant is selected in listing lottery.

listings.Legal_Disclaimers:
All BMR renters must review and acknowledge the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 that governs this property upon the signing of a lease for a BMR unit.

It is also important to note that units governed by the Inclusionary Housing Program are NOT governed by the San Francisco Rent Ordinance (also known as “rent control”). listings.Lottery_Venue: San Francisco Public Library Koret Auditorium, Lower Level
listings.Credit_Rating: A credit report indicating financial responsibilities and a comprehensive unlawful detainer check will be obtained for each adult applicant. Unless satisfactorily explained, there must be no judgments, no accounts rated over 90 days delinquent and no bankruptcy within the last 24 months. Applicant will not be declined for not having any credit history. Applicant(s) must have a current credit rating of 620. Medical debt and student loan debt will not be counted against a household. Lack of established credit or credit score lower than 620 will require an additional deposit equal to one month rent. No outstanding debt to other rental communities is permitted at any time. Applicant(s) must have a positive check writing history. If the applicant(s) have/has a negative check writing history, all future payments to the Community must be made with certified funds, mitigating circumstances will be considered.
listings.Criminal_History:
No felonies within the past seven (7) years. 
Please note, in compliance with Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code, Qualified applicants with criminal history will be considered for housing in compliance with Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code, “The Fair Chance Ordinance.”
listings.Eviction_History: Both the current and previous landlords (going back three years) will be contacted for information concerning the applicant's history regarding documented lease violations and for cause evictions.
listings.Costs_Not_Included:
Late Charge if rent not paid on or before the 3rd of the month: $50.  

Returned Check Charge: $25  

Additional Returned Check Charge: $35  

Renter’s insurance required, provider by Renter’s choice. Average insurance cost to tenant between $10-$20 per month.  

Pets:  Deposit is $500. Pet rent is $65 per monthly. Fees do not apply for service animals.
listings.Required_Documents: Full documentation required if applicant is selected in listing lottery.
listings.Smoking_Policy: Smoke free policy within the property.
listings.Pet_Policy: Pet deposit is $500. Pet rent is $65 per monthly. Fees do not apply for service animals.

Lottery_Preference.Name: Live or Work in San Francisco Preference

listings.Name: 480 Potrero
listings.Legal_Disclaimers:
All BMR renters must review and acknowledge the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 that governs this property upon the signing of a lease for a BMR unit.

Applicants should be informed that BMR rental units in some buildings may convert to ownership units in the future.  In the case of conversion, BMR renters will be afforded certain rights as explained in the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013. Applicants should inquire with the building contact person listed above to determine if the building has a minimum number of years that it must remain a rental building.  (Some buildings may have such restrictions based on government sources of financing for their building.) Most buildings may have no restrictions on conversion at all.

It is also important to note that units governed by the Inclusionary Housing Program are NOT governed by the San Francisco Rent Ordinance (also known as “rent control”). Among other rules, rents may increase beyond increases allowed under “rent control.”  Please see the Inclusionary Affordable Housing Program Monitoring and Procedures Manual 2013 for more information.
listings.Lottery_Venue: Koret Auditorium, San Francisco Main Public Library
listings.Preference_Detail:
All individuals and households may enter the lottery for a BMR unit. 

However, those households in which one member holds a Certificate of Preference (COP) from the former San Francisco Redevelopment Agency will be given highest preference in the lottery ranking process. More information about the COP Program can be found here: http://sfmohcd.org/certificate-preference

Households in which one member holds a Displaced Tenant Housing Preference (DTHP) Certificate from the Mayor’s Office of Housing and Community Development will be given second highest preference in the lottery ranking process, for up to 20% of the units in this project (2 units). DTHP certificate holders will also be included in the live/work preference regardless of their current live/work location. More information about the DTHP Program can be found here: http://sfmohcd.org/displaced-tenant-housing-preference-program-0

Households that submit acceptable documentation that at least one member lives in supervisorial district 10 or within a half-mile of the project will be given the third highest preference in the lottery ranking process under the Neighborhood Resident Housing Preference (NRHP). The NRHP applies to up to 40% of the units in this project (4 units). More information about the NRHP Preference can be found here: https://sfmohcd.org/neighborhood-resident-housing-preference 

Households that submit acceptable documentation that at least one member lives or works in San Francisco will be given the fourth highest preference in the lottery ranking process. 

If the number of units available exceeds the number of qualified applicants in the above listed preference, the units will become available to other qualified applicants outside of San Francisco. Applicants in each preference category must meet program requirements in order to complete the sale or rental.
listings.Credit_Rating:
Credit Standard – The following factors will be considered: missed payments, account in collections or hard inquiries: 

1) Missed payments caused by a situation that has been resolved will not be grounds for denial.  (e.g. lost job has been replaced, divorce has been settled, underwater house was sold, etc.)  Additionally, three (3) or fewer individual missed payments will not be grounds for denial.  Four (4) or more individual missed payments in the previous 2 years or an ongoing issue with non-payment will be considered on a case-by-case basis and may be grounds for denial.

2)	No accounts (other than medical or student) over $1,000 in collection or charged off (i.e. the debt was sold to a third party collector) in the previous 12 months

3)	Fewer than 6 hard inquiries in the past 6 months.

Mitigating criteria will be considered. The complete absence of credit will not be held against a household. Guarantors are also accepted on a case-by-case basis.
listings.Criminal_History: Criminal History Standard – Qualified applicants with criminal history will be considered for housing in compliance with Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code: Fair Chance Ordinance.
listings.Eviction_History: Rental History Standard – Any unlawful detainer in the previous 5 years will be considered and may be the basis for denial. No fault evictions (i.e. Ellis Act, Owner Move-In etc.) will not be held against a household.
listings.Costs_Not_Included: Pets when approved require an additional $500 deposit and monthly pet rent of $75 for dogs and $50 for cats.  (Certified service animals are exempt.)  If there is a fee charged by a credit bureau or similar agency for the credit report, that cost is paid by the tenant. That cost is $18.99 at the time of this writing but subject to change.
listings.Required_Documents: Full documentation required if applicant is selected in listing lottery.
listings.Smoking_Policy: The entire property is strictly a no smoking facility.
listings.Pet_Policy:
Pets when approved require an additional $500 deposit and monthly pet rent of $75 for dogs and $50 for cats. (Certified service animals are exempt).

The building is generally pet-friendly but ownership reserves the right to refuse any pet that is judged to be a threat to health, safety, or property.

listings.Lottery_Summary: Out of 225 applications received, 20 numbers were pulled.
listings.Lottery_Venue: Mayor’s Office of Housing and Community Development
listings.Preference_Detail:
All individuals and households may enter the lottery for a BMR unit. 

However, those households in which one member holds a Certificate of Preference (COP) from the former San Francisco Redevelopment Agency will be given highest preference in the lottery ranking process. More information about the COP Program can be found here: http://sfmohcd.org/certificate-preference

Households in which one member holds a Displaced Tenant Housing Preference (DTHP) Certificate from the Mayor’s Office of Housing and Community Development will be given second highest preference in the lottery ranking process. DTHP certificate holders will also be included in the live/work preference regardless of their current live/work location. More information about the DTHP Program can be found here: http://sfmohcd.org/displaced-tenant-housing-preference-program-0

Households that submit acceptable documentation that at least one member lives or works in San Francisco will be given the fourth highest preference in the lottery ranking process. 

If the number of units available exceeds the number of qualified applicants in the above listed preference, the units will become available to other qualified applicants outside of San Francisco. Applicants in each preference category must meet program requirements in order to complete the sale or rental.
listings.Credit_Rating:
A credit report will be obtained on each applicant after their eligibility for the Inclusionary BMR program has been determined.

A dynamic multi-factor qualification model is used to review an applicant's income, employment stability, residence stability, and credit history to build a total score on a 10 point scale.  With this multi-factor approach, no individual portion of the score alone determines the outcome of the scoring model.  
 
Applicants who fail to satisfy the minimum credit score of 4 based on the scoring model or a have a bankruptcy in process will be rejected.  Applicants who score a 4 and above will be required to pay the standard security deposit for the unit size.  
 
For the purpose of the qualification model, rental, income and credit histories will be considered jointly among multiple household members age 18 and over.
listings.Criminal_History: Criminal reports are not ordered or reviewed until credit history has been ordered and scored with an approval rating.  Qualified applicants with criminal history will be considered for housing in compliance with Article 49 of the San Francisco Police code “Fair Chance Ordinance”.
listings.Eviction_History: Applicants with an eviction by a previous landlord, for cause, within the last 3 years will be rejected.
listings.Costs_Not_Included:
Renter pays own electric, central boiler, water, sewer & trash.

One parking space per unit available for $350 a month.
listings.Amenities: Outdoor Grill Area, 24-Hour Fitness Center, Access Controlled Community, Valet Dry Cleaning Service, Smoke Free Living, WiFi in Lobby, Rooftop Deck, Private Balcony, Wood Plank Flooring, City Skyline Views, Kitchen, Dishwasher
listings.Accessibility: Wheelchair access, Shower grab bars, Accessible Elevator
listings.Required_Documents:
For those selected in the lottery, the following documents may be required:
Completed and signed application
Photo ID
Last three pay stubs
Most recent tax returns
